_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The things that must be developed and cu: The four kinds of mindfulness meditation
The three kinds of good conduct
The development and cultivation of sense: A mendicant sees an agreeable sight with their eye
A mendicant hears an agreeable sound with the ear
A mendicant smells an agreeable odor with the nose
A mendicant tastes an agreeable flavor with the tongue
A mendicant feels an agreeable touch with the body
A mendicant knows an agreeable thought with their mind
The development and cultivation of the t: Giving up bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind
Developing good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind
The development and cultivation of the f: Meditating by observing an aspect of the body
Meditating by observing an aspect of feelings
Meditating by observing an aspect of mind
Meditating by observing an aspect of principles
The development and cultivation of the s: Developing the awakening factor of mindfulness
Developing the awakening factor of investigation of principles
Developing the awakening factor of energy
Developing the awakening factor of rapture
Developing the awakening factor of tranquility
Developing the awakening factor of immersion
Developing the awakening factor of equanimity
